data.title: Great value Thai food
data.text:
An unexpected find whilst strolling about looking for a meal. Quick and attentive service in a basic no frills, but clean dining room. The meal was delicious and very reasonably priced.
We enjoyed it so much we returned to big welcoming smiles the following evening.

data.title: Pretty good
data.text: My favorite place to get good Thai food.  They really have some spicy stuff here, so be sure to ask for mild, unless you can handle the spiciness.  Spring rolls were pretty good too.  Panang curry - you have to try these.

data.title: A great find!
data.text:
What a great find! The Bangkok Cafe is located in a parking lot behind the Voyager Inn and across the road from the Captain Cook Hotel. 

I couldn't get a table on a busy summer weeknight, so ordered "to go" - a green chicken curry with rice for $12.50. It was delicious and easily enough for two people. The menu was extensive.

Highly recommended - make a reservation  - it is very popular.

data.title: Might have ordered the wrong thing, but my dish was not good
data.text: The service was good but my dish was disappointing.  The vegetables were cooked perfectly but the sauce had no flavor.

data.title: Hot, spicy food in central district
data.text: Visible from the Cook hotel, this is a good place to find some Thai menu with the usual accommodations to local produce.  Broccoli and carrot, celery and onion instead of  galangka and Thai small eggplant.  Plenty of hot chili pepper even if you order Medium, so beware.  Tom yum Kung is spicy shrimp soup and the taste was a bit sweet and way too salty, and lacked lemongrass flavor.  Thai people, like my wife, found it a pale copy of the original, but if you hanker for hot, spicy, nearly Thai cuisine, it's worth a taste.  Portions are generous and they serve wine and beer.  Family owned and operated, service is friendly and adequate.  Great value for this town. Try a noodle dish and an egg roll for starters.

data.title: Not to be missed for a wonderful meal
data.text: While from the outside this place looks like a hole in the wall, I had read reviews on Tripadvisor and went here for dinner.  What a great meal we had.  We love Thai food and everything we had was delicious and cost about the same as a Thai meal in the lower 48 which was another bonus.  And having been to Thailand, the taste was authentic.  Their menu is plentiful and they will customized the spicy-ness to your liking.  I recommended the restaurant which was located right across the street from the hotel we were staying out to a few people in my tour group and everyone of them thanked me for the recommendation as they loved it as well.

data.title: Hidden away good Thai food
data.text: A small restaurant tucked away near the Captain Cook hotel, this is a nice clean place to get a delicious meal served by a friendly staff at a reasonable price.

data.title: Nice Thai restaurant
data.text: We had a very nice dinner here. We shared the Tom kai gai soup, which was medium spicy and then the Panang curry. At other Thai restaurants, the Panang curry is thicker, with more coconut milk I guess. So this one was thinner but nicely spiced and very tasty. It is located right downtown across from the Captain Cook hotel, but it does not face the street, it faces a parking lot. It was Saturday night and we had tried a couple other restaurants and were told the wait would be 1 hour and 45 minutes. We were able to walk right in here and be seated right away. So glad we tried it.

data.title: Delicious Thai food at affordable price
data.text: We came to Bangkok Cafe to have many lunches and dinners while staying in Anchorage. The food was delicious, service was excellent and the price was right.

data.title: A great first Alaskan meal
data.text: So, you just get off your plane in Alaska nd look for something to eat and directly across from your hotel is the family run Bangkok Cafe; Nice local place with decent food - not what you normally think of your first meal in Alaska, but it was a darn good meal

data.title: Fabulous Thai Food!
data.text:
I was so pleasantly surprised & happy to find the food to be so good here, which is smack downtown, located by one of Anchorage's best hotels! The food was mouth-watering, the service was excellent, the convenience (especially for visitors & folks who work downtown) is perfect. 
I now plan to make this my go-to Thai restaurant.

data.title: Hidden gem.
data.text: Fortunately someone in our tour group told us about this little Thai restaurant.  Located along the side of a building facing a parking lot, it would be easy to miss.  I started my lunch with Tom Kha Gai (coconut milk soup) with shrimp with only a touch of heat; delicious!  Husband thoroughly enjoyed the Tom Yum (hot and sour soup) with shrimp level 3 on the restaurant's spice scale which he found.  We then shared a delicious chicken panning curry dish with brown rice (kinder to diabetics than white rice).  The ingredients in our soups and the curry were fresh and prepared to order with an experienced hand.  Portions were generous and prices surprisingly reasonable for Alaska.

data.title: What a gem
data.text: Right across from The Captain Cook Hotel, this little restaurant serves lunches and evening meals. The food is Thai and delicious, so good that we were there three times in the three days we were in Anchorage!  It is licensed and usually quite busy, yet the service is quick and efficient and it has a warm, cosy atmosphere.

data.title: Tasty Thai
data.text:
A vey good place for a nice Thai meal, very reasonably priced and friendly service.
We just happened to spot it, across the hotel, we have not seen it advertised in any brochure. Dine in or take away

data.title: Uneven
data.text: I got a nice reception from the owner/hostess/waitress.  The dining room was very basic but clean.  There are only about 8 tables.  I ordered the fried spring rolls, pad thai, and Thai coconut layer cake.  The spring rolls ($5) were burnt but tasty; the sauce was tasty.  I asked for very mild pad thai ($11) with shrimps; this was excellent, with about 8 nice shrimp and just a little spicier than I'm used to.  The cake ($6) was very disappointing, it was gelatinous and jiggly, like three layers of Jell-O.  I didn't even eat it.  They also offer wine (Columbia Crest, etc) and beer (Heineken, Corona, etc).  I would go again.

data.title: Spicy, yummy, great place.
data.text: This small little restaurant is big on friendly service and spicy food. They have a rating system - 1 to 10 - and unless you want to sweat while you eat, select on the lower end of the heat spectrum. I have the tom kah gai soup at a 2 and it's still spicy. Their pad thai is different than other places, but grows on you. And their beef and vegetable 'salad' is simply awesome. Visit. You will love it!

data.title: Nice surprise!  Food was great!
data.text: Happened on this restaurant by accident, (unusual for me since I am a tripadvisor nut).  The food was out standing, They offer the spice from 1-7...  I tried the 4 and it was almost too hot!  I have never had a spicy salad, but they did a great job.  All the food was very tasty, well worth the visit!

data.title: Dinner with sister.
data.text: My sister wanted hot and I wanted mild. We each ordered from the prompt and friendly waitress. She got duck and I got beef and rice. We had freshly made spring rolls to start and they actually came ahead of the meal. All the food was very good and mine was mild with sauces on the side for me to add as much as I wanted.

data.title: This Thai restaurant is yummy !!
data.text: I ordered egg rolls and Pad Krapaw (basil chicken dish). I got medium spicy and it burned my lips, which I like. The food was very fresh and delicious. I will definitely be back to eat here. Great place to eat and good prices...

data.title: Don't be fooled by it's outward appearance
data.text:
Was looking for somewhere for a light meal.
Spotted this café in a car park across from the hotel
Turned out the food was very good and at a reasonable cost.
Very pleasant waitress.
